org.openbel.framework.core
Class CommandLineApplication

java.lang.Object
  org.openbel.framework.core.CommandLineApplication
Direct Known Subclasses:
Backtrack, BelCheck, CacheManager, DocumentConverter, KamComparator, KamManager, PhaseApplication, PhaseZeroApplication, Semantics
public abstract class CommandLineApplication
extends Object

Base class for BEL command-line applications.

  1. The only call to System.exit(int) should be done in systemExit(ExitCode).
  2. Command-line applications should support output/error redirection to streams beyond stdout and stderr.
  3. Command-line applications should needs to be constructed before any logging statement are executed.

BEL command-line applications are built using a mix of Java and XML-centric container configuration mechanisms (for more information, see The IoC container).

This approach has a number of advantages:

  • It is simple to create new command-line applications
  • Deriving from command-line applications is feasible and straightforward
  • Unmatched debugging capabilities
  • Execution times can be very quick, providing typical command-line execution speeds

getUsage

public abstract String getUsage()
Returns a detailed description of the application's command-line.

Optional arguments should be wrapped in [] brackets. For example: [-o somearg]. Arguments that can occur more than once should be followed with ellipses (...), for example: [-f FILE...].

Returns:
Non-null string

addOption

public final void addOption(String shortOpt,
                            String longOpt,
                            String desc)
Adds a command-line option. This is only useful before calling start.

Parameters:
shortOpt - Short, one character option (e.g., -t)
longOpt - Long, one or two word option (e.g., --long-option)
desc - Option description (e.g., does something great)

getCommandLineOptions

public abstract List<org.apache.commons.cli.Option> getCommandLineOptions()
Returns command-line options used by the application.

Options specifies by subclasses should adhere to the convention of a single-character short option with an optional long option.

Returns:
List of options, may be null or empty
See Also:
addOption(String, String, String, boolean)

attemptSystemConfiguration

protected final void attemptSystemConfiguration()
                                         throws IOException
Initializes the system configuration from either #LONG_OPT_SYSCFG or system defaults.

This is an alternative means of initializing the system configuration for applications interested in handling the possibility of an IOException.

Throws:
IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurs during initialization of the system configuration
See Also:
initializeSystemConfiguration()

initializeSystemConfiguration

protected final void initializeSystemConfiguration()
Initializes the system configuration from either #SHRT_OPT_SYSCFG or system defaults.

This method will initialize the system configuration or die trying.

Throws:
IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurs during initialization of the system configuration
See Also:
attemptSystemConfiguration()
